args.natural_language_statement: Let n>0 be an integer and let a,b ∈ Z. Prove that a ≡ b (mod n) if and only if a and b have the same remainder upon division by n. Translate into Lean4 code, ending with := by sorry.

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Let n>0 be an integer and let a,b ∈ ℤ. Then a ≡ b (mod n) iff a and b have the same remainder upon division by n. -/
theorem int_congr_mod_iff_same_remainder {a b n : ℤ} (hn : 0 < n) : n ∣ (a - b) ↔ a % n = b % n := by sorry
